meanings.definition: To close or seal with a cork.
meanings.sent1: I corked the bottle tightly to keep the liquid inside.
meanings.sent2: She always corked the wine bottles after opening them.
meanings.sent3: The chef corked the saucepan to prevent any spills.
meanings.sent4: The explorer corked the map in a secret compartment.
meanings.sent5: He corked the message in a bottle and threw it into the sea.

meanings.definition: Spoiled or tainted, as wine that has been contaminated by a cork.
meanings.sent1: The corked wine had a musty smell and taste.
meanings.sent2: The guests noticed the corked wine and politely declined more.
meanings.sent3: She joked that the corked wine tasted like old socks.
meanings.sent4: The party was a disaster with all the corked drinks.
meanings.sent5: The corked wine left a lingering unpleasant aftertaste.
